component.name: getStatusesMentionsTimeline
component.description: Returns a collection of the most recent Tweets and retweets posted by the authenticating user and the users they follow. The home timeline is central to how most users interact with the Twitter service.

component.name: getStatusesUserTimeline
component.description: Returns a collection of the most recent Tweets posted by the user indicated by the screen_name or user_id parameters.

component.name: getStatusesHomeTimeline
component.description: Returns the 20 most recent mentions (tweets containing a users’s @screen_name) for the authenticating user. The timeline returned is the equivalent of the one seen when you view your mentions on twitter.com. This method can only return up to 800 tweets.

component.name: getStatusesRetweetsOfMe
component.description: Returns the most recent tweets authored by the authenticating user that have been retweeted by others. This timeline is a subset of the user’s GET statuses / user_timeline.

component.name: getStatusesRetweetersIds
component.description: Returns a collection of up to 100 user IDs belonging to users who have retweeted the tweet specified by the id parameter. This method offers similar data to GET statuses / retweets / :id.

component.name: getStatusesLookup
component.description: Returns fully-hydrated tweet objects for up to 100 tweets per request, as specified by comma-separated values passed to the id parameter. This method is especially useful to get the details (hydrate) a collection of Tweet IDs.
